snippet: After 25 years, Mr. Trotter plans to close the restaurant that bears his name so that he can travel and go to school.
abstract: After 25 years, Mr. Trotter plans to close the restaurant that bears his name so that he can travel and go to school.
lead_paragraph: 10:43 p.m. | Updated For a complete version of this article, see "Chicago Losing a Chef Who Refined Its Stockyards Palate," by Monica Davey of The New York Times.Charlie Trotter plans to close his famous Chicago restaurant in August, 25 years after it opened in a Lincoln Park townhouse and quickly became a national destination, The Chicago Sun-Times reported on Sunday.
